publicwhip.spmotion: S3M-4545 Jamie Hepburn: Condemnation of the Coup d’état in Honduras—That the Parliament condemns the coup undertaken on 28 June 2009 in Honduras against the democratically elected government of President Manuel Zelaya; further condemns the kidnapping of the Cuban, Nicaraguan and Venezuelan ambassadors to Honduras as being totally contrary to the diplomatic norms of cordial relations between countries; notes the condemnation of this coup across the international community, including by the General Secretary of the United Nations, the President of the United States of America, the Organisation of American States, the Association of Caribbean States and many other governments, and believes that President Manuel Zelaya should be allowed to return to Honduras without threat of arrest and detention and to complete his term of office as the democratically elected head of state and head of government of the Republic of Honduras. Supported by: Bill Kidd, Bob Doris, Alasdair Allan, Anne McLaughlin, Patricia Ferguson, Hugh O’Donnell, Aileen Campbell, Bill Wilson, Bill Butler
S3M-4545 Condemnation of the Coup d’Etat in Honduras (lodged on 30 June 2009) Elaine Smith*
